title.subtitle_english: A path to Bashkir culture and language

legacy_proverb.english: People live forever not through their bodies, but through their good deeds
legacy_proverb.phonetic: ke-she-LAR tan-da-RE me-NAN tu-GEL, a iz-GE esh-ta-RE me-NAN man-GE ya-sha-Y-zar

memory_palace_stations.title: The Birth of Heroes
memory_palace_stations.summary: Yanbirde and Yanbike raise two sons: Shulgen and Ural
memory_palace_stations.memory_peg: BIRTH = New BEGINNING on an island
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: A tiny island after a flood. An elderly couple with silver hair. Two boys ‚Äî one with dark eyes, one with bright eyes.

memory_palace_stations.title: The White Swan Maidens
memory_palace_stations.summary: The brothers discover swan maidens; Ural shows kindness
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Crystal lake. Seven swans become women. One brother grabs robes, the other returns them.

memory_palace_stations.title: The Quest Begins
memory_palace_stations.summary: Ural seeks the Spring of Life; Shulgen chooses darkness
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Crossroads at dawn. One path lit by sun, one shrouded in shadow. Two brothers part ways.

memory_palace_stations.title: The Kingdom of Samrau
memory_palace_stations.summary: Ural wins King Samrau's trust and Humai's love
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Palace above clouds. Giant bird-king on throne. Swan maiden recognizes the kind brother.

memory_palace_stations.title: The Serpent's Domain
memory_palace_stations.summary: Shulgen joins Kahkaha and gains dark powers
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Dark cave lit by hellfire. Bronze dragon offers cup of venom. Man drinks‚Äîeyes turn yellow.

memory_palace_stations.title: Trials of the Hero
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Sphinx asking riddles. Battlefield of ghosts. Village of sick people being healed.

memory_palace_stations.title: War of Light and Darkness
memory_palace_stations.summary: Brother faces brother as Kahkaha's armies attack
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Mountain shaking. Two brothers fighting. One falls, asking forgiveness.

memory_palace_stations.title: The Final Battle
memory_palace_stations.summary: Ural defeats Kahkaha through the power of love
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Dragon recoiling from words of love. Glowing sword finds the hidden heart.

memory_palace_stations.title: The Spring of Life
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Golden spring on mountaintop. Man pours water outward instead of drinking. Light spreads everywhere.

memory_palace_stations.title: The Hero's Legacy
memory_palace_stations.summary: Ural becomes the mountains‚Äîliving forever through his deeds
memory_palace_stations.memory_image: Man transforming into mountain range. Swan singing on highest peak. People gathering in the valleys.

title.subtitle: 12 Reasons Why Bashkirs Must Attain Independence

reasons.title: Colonial Status
reasons.description: Resources extracted while local interests ignored. Bashkortostan's vast natural wealth‚Äîoil, gas, minerals‚Äîflows to Moscow while the republic remains economically subordinate.

reasons.title: Indigenous Rights
reasons.description: Bashkirs are indigenous to their land with no other homeland on Earth. International law recognizes the rights of indigenous peoples to self-determination.

reasons.title: Legal Rights
reasons.description: International law supports self-determination for peoples under colonial rule. The UN Charter and multiple declarations affirm this fundamental right.

reasons.title: Historical Oppression
reasons.description: Centuries of colonization have made Bashkirs a minority in their own homeland. What was once a Bashkir-majority territory now has Bashkirs as only 30% of the population.

reasons.title: Religious Oppression
reasons.description: The Muslim majority faces institutional discrimination. Religious practice is monitored, mosques are controlled, and Islamic education is restricted.

reasons.title: Language Oppression
reasons.description: Systematic destruction of the Bashkir language since 2017 policy changes removed mandatory Bashkir language education. UNESCO classifies Bashkir as 'vulnerable.'

reasons.title: Cultural Oppression
reasons.description: Authentic cultural expression is suppressed while folklore is commodified. Traditional practices are discouraged or co-opted by the state.

reasons.title: Replacing Heroes
reasons.description: Genuine Bashkir heroes are replaced with Moscow-serving figures. The true story of Salavat Yulaev is sanitized to remove anti-colonial elements.

reasons.title: Persecution
reasons.description: Ongoing persecution of political figures and activists. The 2024 Baymak protests and imprisonment of Fail Alsynov demonstrate continued repression.

reasons.title: Resource Theft
reasons.description: Natural resources are extracted for Moscow's benefit. Oil, gas, and minerals leave Bashkortostan while the republic sees little return.

reasons.title: Assimilation
reasons.description: Large-scale cultural and linguistic assimilation threatens Bashkir identity. Russian-language dominance erodes intergenerational transmission of culture.

reasons.title: Economic Exploitation
reasons.description: Despite vast resources, Bashkortostan remains economically subordinate. Wealth flows out while infrastructure and social services suffer.

landmarks.name: Mount Yamantau
landmarks.description: 1,640m - Highest peak in the Southern Urals. 'Bad Mountain' in Bashkir.
landmarks.significance: Sacred mountain in Ural-Batyr epic - site of transformation

landmarks.name: Mount Iremel
landmarks.significance: Holy mountain where shamans sought visions

landmarks.name: Kushtau
landmarks.description: Symbol of 2020 environmental victory. 'Twin Mountains' in Bashkir.
landmarks.significance: 2020: People protected the mountain from mining

landmarks.name: Shulgan-Tash Cave
landmarks.significance: Named for Shulgen - he guards the ancient memory in darkness

landmarks.name: Agidel River
landmarks.description: Main river, 1,430 km. 'White River' in Bashkir.
landmarks.significance: Sacred river flowing from the Urals

facts.title: Ural Mountains
facts.content: The Ural Mountains run through Bashkortostan. Legend says these are Ural-Batyr's transformed body, protecting his people forever.

facts.title: Borders
facts.content: Bashkortostan borders Tatarstan, Udmurtia, Perm Krai, Sverdlovsk, Chelyabinsk, and Orenburg oblasts.

facts.title: Forests
facts.content: 40% of Bashkortostan is covered by forests, including taiga and mixed forests.

facts.title: Rivers
facts.content: Over 12,000 rivers flow through Bashkortostan, including the Belaya (Agidel), Ufa, and Dema.

facts.title: Oil & Gas
facts.content: Major oil and gas producer since the 1930s. The Ishimbay oil field was one of the 'Second Baku' discoveries.

facts.title: Honey
facts.content: Bashkortostan is famous for its honey, especially from the wild Burzyan bee. '–ë–∞–ª' (bal) means honey.

alphabet.description: 42 letters based on Cyrillic, including 9 unique letters not found in Russian

proverbs.english: People live forever not through their bodies, but through their good deeds
A foolish head gives no rest to the feet
A tree is strong by its roots
Native land is a golden cradle
The hero doesn't die, his name remains
Water is the spring of life
The hero's path leads to humanity

timeline.event: First written mentions of Bashkirs in Arab sources
Voluntary union with Russia - treaty guarantees autonomy
Kisyabika Bayryasova executed for leading uprising
Salavat Yulaev fights in Pugachev Rebellion
Bashkir ASSR formed - first Soviet autonomous republic
Kushtau Victory - people protect sacred mountain from mining
Baymak protests after Fail Alsynov's imprisonment
